Description: The COVID-19 pandemic changed how many things are done in science and in the clinic, and many of these changes should be continued further. There were unprecedented scientific collaborations between academic laboratories, industry and regulatory agencies, clinical trial conduct became patient-centric, review of clinical trial protocols became streamlined, telemedicine allowed reaching more patients, there was an increased focus in addressing healthcare inequities. It will be important to perpetuate the beneficial changes induced by the pandemic.
Location: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
SearchResultBody: FO04. Breaking Down Silos: If We Did It During the COVID Pandemic, Why Not for Cancer?
SearchResultFooter: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
Title: Breaking Down Silos: If We Did It During the COVID Pandemic, Why Not for Cancer?
